Text: A reminder to organizations interested in participating in my Youth Opportunities Fair this year: The deadline to apply is this Friday, February 25th! https://t.co/7Wnz9KOGHn

This evening I was pleased to give a keynote address for the Burmese American Community Institute‚Äôs 75th Union Day commemoration. Indiana will receive more than $14 million in the first round of funding for this effort! #DemocratsDeliver https://t.co/VqxV5hfIil

Soon, @POTUS will make history by nominating the first Black woman to the Supreme Court. In this week's @IndyRecorder, I discuss why taking this monumental step, and increasing diversity across the judiciary, is vitally important.
https://t.co/XU6QKppoIm
I‚Äôm honored to vote for this legislation which passed the House today! https://t.co/M7ytqhUFR0

We've passed another grim milestone in the COVID-19 pandemic. We will never forget the 900,000 fellow Americans we've lost to this virus. To honor them, I've introduced a bill to commission a memorial quilt, similar to the AIDS quilt, and I'm working hard to get it enacted. https://t.co/ocKG59vdoI

This month, we are uplifting the stories of Black people -- known and unknown -- who have left an enduring legacy. But let's be clear: Black history should be taught, studied and celebrated 365 days a year. Let's make it our mission. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/bdXucp0LOE

Happy birthday to #RosaParks, who was born on this day in 1913! Her courageous actions led to the desegregation of the Montgomery, Alabama bus system and helped spark the modern civil rights movement. We are grateful to her on this #TransitEquityDay, and every day! https://t.co/XKYgEOX2Kr

I am proud to support the historic #AmericaCOMPETES Act today. This legislation will ensure more workers and businesses can #MakeItInAmerica by:

- Supporting our workers with good-paying jobs
- Expanding STEM opportunities
- Ensuring America can compete on the global stage

467,000 jobs -- this is great news!

Despite our ongoing challenges, @POTUS and Democrats in Congress have laid the groundwork for a strong economic recovery that puts people first. Let's keep it up! https://t.co/Tr8vA2EATx

I commend my congressional colleagues for urging @POTUS¬†to investigate the killing of a Palestinian-American by members of the Israeli military, and I join their call. His loved ones deserve answers, and any act of wrongdoing demands accountability.
https://t.co/IgninbdiQg

As our region prepares for a major winter storm, I urge all Hoosiers to be weather aware. 

Be sure to follow the guidance of @NWSIndianapolis, @IndyMayorJoe, @IndySnowForce, and other local officials to help stay safe, and please stay off the roads if at all possible.
Happy #WorldHijabDay! https://t.co/jSVwB1wUDF

Happy #BlackHistoryMonth! This commemoration is more than a celebration of our history. It's a renewal of our commitment to carry on the legacy of our ancestors, so we can create a better world for all. What does that effort look like to you? #OurPowerOurMessage https://t.co/v9ndGUDtgd

This #NationalMentoringMonth, I'm pleased to reintroduce my Transition to Success Mentoring Act. This bill awards grants that will establish and expand school-based mentoring programs to support at-risk middle school students across America. I'll work hard to get it passed. https://t.co/Yr3tYlzSmx

That's why I proudly cosponsored @RepJohnLarson's bill called Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act. This legislation will expand and improve benefits for years to come. Let's pass it ASAP! #Secure2100

#SocialSecurity is a lifeline to many in our community and across America. As we celebrate 82 years since the first Social Security check was delivered, I'm reaffirming my commitment to protecting this program that Democrats enacted. https://t.co/H2pdCxlLVg

This week I had a great time meeting with interns serving in the Indiana General Assembly. These conversations are a great reminder of how many promising young leaders we have in our state! #Hoosiers https://t.co/nRInZN76I9

We must also remember the history that led to the #Holocaust. For centuries, antisemitism and violence towards Jewish people was normalized -- perpetuated by many and ignored by countless more. That's why it's necessary for all of us to strongly condemn hatred wherever we see it.

Today, on #HolocaustRemembranceDay, and every day, I stand shoulder to shoulder with the Jewish community, as we continue working together to end the culture of hate and antisemitism that led to the genocide of six million Jews and millions more. We will #NeverForget.
Our historic economic growth is no accident. It's proof that Democrats' economic strategy that puts people first is working. Let's keep it up! #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/gNyGRhiSVF

Thank you, Justice Breyer, for your years of service on the Supreme Court, & enjoy your upcoming retirement.

The #CleanAirAct is vital for protecting Hoosier families from carbon pollution -- but many Republicans are trying to undermine this important law through cynical lawsuits.

That's why I'm joining my Democratic colleagues and urging the Supreme Court to defend the #CleanAirAct. https://t.co/hExTDf6VDq
My live listening session town hall is happening today! Head over to my official Facebook page at 5pm to participate in the discussion. See you soon! https://t.co/vg917Je2d3 https://t.co/22YSBi7IWd

We won't be deterred by yesterday's setback in the Senate on #votingrights. This priority is too big to give up. The strength of our Democracy depends on securing the right to vote for every American, and we will get it done together.

Next week, I'm excited to host a live listening session town hall on Facebook! I want to hear what your policy priorities are for 2022, so please write your questions or comments in the replies below. I'll do my best to answer as many as possible during the event. See you there! https://t.co/9GYBpsALFg

Good news: The Biden Administration is now sending free at-home Covid tests to households across America. I encourage everyone to utilize this free resource to help protect you and your loved ones.

You can place your order here: https://t.co/ysjyD3D7Aq

Happy Dr. #MartinLutherKingJr Day! Today, and every day, we celebrate his amazing life and his ongoing legacy. Our current efforts to #BuildBackBetter and strengthen #VotingRights are a continuation of his work to create a more equal and just society for all. https://t.co/kLJ1FAtlBB

I‚Äôm praying for everyone affected by the hostage situation at a synagogue in Colleyville, Texas, and I‚Äôm grateful to the first responders working tirelessly to save lives. We must continue doing all we can to stop the violence against our Jewish brothers and sisters.

Attention Hoosiers! Today is the last day of #OpenEnrollment¬†season, which is your chance to sign up for health coverage this year under the Affordable Care Act. The deadline is midnight, so don't delay! Visit https://t.co/1fNkJqS3xK¬†to choose a health plan that's right for you.

Great news! The new Infrastructure Law will provide more than $400 million to Indiana over the next five years to help invest in our bridges. I proudly voted for this landmark law because I knew Hoosiers would benefit, and it's already delivering for our state. https://t.co/mAGV9yjoYQ

Our fight to protect the vote is urgent, and @HouseDemocrats aren't wasting time. 

Today, we approved a bill that includes key parts of the Freedom to Vote Act & the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. It now heads to the Senate for consideration.

Let's get this done.
This important bill has just passed the House! I urge the Senate to also pass our bill ASAP to help ensure equal access to G.I. benefits for all who bravely serve our country. https://t.co/6tGEaWclq5

That's why we must #AbolishTheFilibuster to stop the ongoing assault on our right to vote. I also urge the Biden Administration to use every tool at its disposal to strengthen voting rights. It's all hands on deck to save our Democracy. https://t.co/z3EA2cSIWm

They're abusing the filibuster to prevent a vote on these bills, while GOP leaders in states across America enact voter suppression laws. These bills to weaken voting rights are being passed by a simple majority, but the U.S. Senate can't do the same to strengthen voting rights!

Thank you, @POTUS and @VP, for leading the charge today to securing voting rights for every American. The House has passed two bills to achieve this -- the For the People Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act, but @SenateGOP is blocking them.
A well-deserved honor! Let's continue working hard to properly recognize the women of color who have enriched America and our entire world. https://t.co/nL31vkTiHl

Ahead of the big game, we had a great discussion with student athletes at the school¬†about the importance of sports in education. Studies show that playing sports provides immense benefits for students, which is why we must strengthen these opportunities for all of our kids.

Thank you to students and staff at Decatur Central High school¬†who gave a big Hoosier welcome to @SecCardona¬†from @usedgov. He's in town to help honor America's educators in conjunction with the National Championship Game, being held here tonight. https://t.co/Qe1h4HYr6l
I hope you‚Äôll tune in tonight to this special episode, where I‚Äôll be talking about #UAPs (UFOs) and the risk they pose to our national security. üõ∏ https://t.co/dq9e5uZMjI
The #BuildBackBetter economy is working. Let's keep it up! https://t.co/cdEe2rWl7S

Today, many will claim #Jan6th¬†was just a protest that got out of hand. Don't be gaslit. That day, a man drove to DC with a truck full of explosives & my name on a hit list, because I'm Muslim. We can't fully overcome this tragic day until we fully reject the revisionist history.
One year since the insurrection at the U.S. Capitol, I am more committed than ever to protecting our Democracy. Read my full statement: https://t.co/AROcZzxB8l

As Covid cases hit record highs, I continue to support our brave health care workers and nurses who are taking a stand by petitioning federal court for a permanent health standard from @OSHA_DOL. We must protect our health care workers who continue to put their own lives at risk.
In 2021, my office and I worked hard to meet the challenges facing Hoosiers. Here are some of the highlights: https://t.co/xJFHcSumWx
Now, countless Hoosiers and folks across the country will be protected from financial hardship due to unexpected bills from out of network medical providers.
Good news! As of Jan 1st, most surprise medical bills are now illegal, thanks to the enactment of the 'No Surprises Act,' which I was honored to vote for.
Happy New Year! I‚Äôm wishing everyone a happy, healthy and prosperous 2022. https://t.co/k5iWu2GzcR

This holiday season has had its challenges, but there‚Äôs also a lot to celebrate. 

Our economy is recovering, we‚Äôve enacted landmark legislation like the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, and COVID-19 vaccines are saving countless lives.  
 
Let‚Äôs carry this momentum into 2022!
#HappyKwanzaa¬†to everyone observing this celebration of Black history and culture. Our legacy is powerful and our future is bright -- especially when we are united. #Umoja https://t.co/3kGAtcbYNt

#MerryChristmas¬†to everyone celebrating here in Indiana and around the world! I hope you and your loved ones have a wonderful and festive day, however you choose to celebrate. https://t.co/GrI8PIwrj0

I applaud this necessary move by the Biden Administration to provide relief to millions of student loan borrowers. This is one of many steps that we should take to ease the crushing burden of student loan debt during this pandemic and into the future. https://t.co/EKXe5m0tFL

I applaud @POTUS on his announcement today to assist Hoosier hospitals and communities in the battle against COVID-19. The pandemic isn‚Äôt over and Indiana is thankful for the assistance with medical personnel, testing, ventilators and vaccines. https://t.co/Kkmr7sYKDG

The U.S. has a responsibility to defend human rights wherever they're threatened. That's why I'm pleased Congress recently acted to stop China's mistreatment of #Uyghurs. In my latest op-ed for @CNN, I explain why this bipartisan effort is long overdue.
https://t.co/uudtOGEgYA

Thank you, @POTUS, for signing our bipartisan bill into law today. The 13 servicemembers we lost, including Hoosier Cpl. Humberto Sanchez, represent the best of our country. We will never forget their service, selflessness, and bravery. https://t.co/OuW8hxkhdz https://t.co/yeQQH7yJKE
The #ChildTaxCredit has helped millions of Hoosier kids and their families. We need extend it by passing the #BuildBackBetter Act.

Attention Hoosiers! Today is the last day of #OpenEnrollment season to sign up for health coverage that begins in the new year. Don't miss out on a happier and healthier 2022. Visit https://t.co/XkdiasgUIH to shop for quality and affordable plans. https://t.co/HMJsVSk7Y6

Every day we are reminded that the climate crisis isn't a far off threat -- it's happening right now. The #BuildBackBetter Act will provide us with the tools needed to protect our planet for us and for future generations. https://t.co/6oinwWQylD

Here in America and around the world, Muslims are being threatened by bigotry and violence, and the U.S. has a responsibility to act. https://t.co/jjeNgvHsVj

In Indianapolis, and across America, Black and Brown people looking to buy a home are more likely to be denied a mortgage than their white counterparts. I recently spoke to @themarkup about the urgent need to end housing and lending discrimination.
https://t.co/LyVGbC3Sw0

Happy Birthday, Indiana! Our state was admitted to the union on this day in 1816. I‚Äôm proud to be a Hoosier, and I‚Äôll keep working hard to ensure equality and opportunity for all who call this state home. https://t.co/oLMmpSDdRW

This morning, I was happy to help out at @ymcaindy‚Äôs annual toy drive. Thank you to this great organization and to all the volunteers who helped make the season brighter for thousands of Hoosier families. https://t.co/R4elFfWfCn

Today is #HumanRightsDay, an occasion to mark the day the @UN¬†adopted the International Declaration of Human Rights in 1948. This was a milestone, but it was only one step in our long journey to ensure everyone's basic human rights. Let's keep up this important work.

This minority group endures immense persecution there, and our country -- and every country -- should not be helping China profit from their oppression. I'm proud that these bills passed almost unanimously, proving that securing Uyghurs‚Äô human rights is a bipartisan priority.

The House passed bills to ban the import of goods from the Xinjiang region that are made using forced labor from Uyghur Muslims and condemned the ongoing genocide and crimes against humanity being committed against Uyghurs.
This week, we took another important step toward holding China accountable.

Last evening, on the steps of the U.S. Capitol, my colleagues and I in @TheBlackCaucus held a vigil for justice and called on the Senate to pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. We must protect this sacred right. https://t.co/J7RwQH2jPC

We also voted to safeguard the full faith and credit of the United States by addressing the debt limit. Failing to do this would result in worldwide economic catastrophe. We must do all we can to continue supporting our strong economic recovery from the pandemic.

Great news! The House passed the #NDAA, our yearly defense authorization bill. The bill contains a much-deserved pay increase for our service members. It also contains provisions to help stop sexual assaults in the military.

Today marks 80 years since the attack on #PearlHarbor. We honor all the Americans who were killed that day, as well as every member of the greatest generation who courageously protected our country from tyranny. We must continue to learn from their example. https://t.co/Eim6OVeTxW

Rest In Peace to former Sen. #BobDole, who will lie in state this week in the Capitol Rotunda. His bravery in the Second World War and his decades of public service will never be forgotten. I send my condolences to his wife, former Sen. Elizabeth Dole, and all his loved ones.

My office was able to help #veteran, Patrick, and his wife obtain the benefits they earned. In fact, we've helped secure millions of dollars for veterans throughout my district. If you are a veteran and need assistance, please don't hesitate to call my office 317-283-6516. https://t.co/I83de0nVyr

On this day in 1865, the 13th Amendment was ratified. It ended slavery in the United States except in the prison system, where Americans are still being exploited for unpaid labor. It's time to #EndTheException by passing the #AbolitionAmendment. https://t.co/4RjsTv5wXM
The House has passed the #BuildBackBetter Act. I now urge my Senate colleagues to be equally bold and pass it as well so @POTUS can sign it into law. https://t.co/ax7nliwB0r

Today at around 1:15pm I‚Äôll be on @MSNBC talking to @AlexWitt about the need to move America forward, reject the harmful words of some of my Republican colleagues, and get answers about January 6th. Be sure to tune in!

I had a wonderful time at @IndLatinoExpo‚Äôs event last night, where I helped honor a very special Hoosier ‚Äî my friend Maria Luisa Tishner. Thanks to her, this great organization and its Executive Director, Gloria Jimenez, for all their great work. https://t.co/0n2S2vxNZb

This holiday season, I'm thankful for the progress that we're making to #BuildBackBetter. In my latest column in the @IndyRecorder, I recap this year's achievements and the work ahead.
https://t.co/oja8eTkBom

The House has passed the #BuildBackBetterAct -- a transformative bill that makes much-needed investments for Hoosiers and all Americans.

Now, I urge the Senate to be bold and pass it so @POTUS can sign it into law.

Let's get this landmark legislation enacted asap!
I'm honored to help chair today‚Äôs critical @TransportDems oversight hearing on cyber threats to our infrastructure. https://t.co/dx0tIhwuct

We've also made major progress in saving lives. HIV is no longer a death sentence, but only if vulnerable communities have the tools they need to live healthy lives free of stigma. Let's continue this important work to educate people, expand treatments, and find a cure.
This #WorldAIDSDay marks 40 years since the beginning of the HIV/AIDS epidemic. In that time, we've lost millions to this virus, all of whom we honor. https://t.co/um2wZJtjzV

Today my colleagues and I called on House Republicans to condemn the Islamophobia in their caucus that is creating a dangerous climate for Muslim-Americans. The People's House must send a message that this bigotry -- and any kind of hate -- should have no place in our country. https://t.co/3L4dphuW3y

Islamophobia should have no place anywhere in America, let alone in the halls of Congress. You can watch the press conference led by @RepAndreCarson, @RepRashida, and @Ilhan below. https://t.co/ZbnyXorZHm

If Roe is overturned, Republicans could outlaw abortion in 26 states, including Indiana. This would be devastating for Hoosier families.
https://t.co/YU9aNIS0YB

As the Supreme Court prepares to take up a case that could determine the future of Roe v. Wade, we have to continue raising our voices in defense of reproductive freedoms. Repealing this right would be disastrous. We can't go backward. 
https://t.co/kOWSk9F08w
#HappyHanukkah to everybody celebrating in Indiana and around the world! May this be a time of joy and light for you and your loved ones. https://t.co/3OUySfiq4B

#HappyThanksgiving! Despite the many challenges we face, we have a lot to be thankful for. I'm thankful every day to represent the wonderful people of Indiana's 7th congressional district, and I never take that honor for granted. Together, we will continue to #BuildBackBetter. https://t.co/lRqrsBSxMF

Justice was served today in the trial of the three men who killed #AhmaudArbery. However this verdict won't bring him back, or any other Black person brutally murdered. We must keep working to end the climate of racism and violence that has taken so many from us.

Great News: Weekly jobless claims just hit their lowest level in over 50 years! There's still a lot of work ahead to #BuildBackBetter, but this data shows that Democrats' strategy to recover from the pandemic is working, and that the American people are resilient!
We must do much more to honor that history and uplift Native communities across the U.S.

November is #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth. I'm proud of the long legacy of Native Americans in our state -- that includes tribal nations like the Shawnee, Miami, Illinois, Delaware, Chickasaw, Wyandot and many others. https://t.co/3vCuBS8t5P

I‚Äôm honored to cosponsor this resolution on behalf of those we have lost. https://t.co/bQUpseO9qE

I am very disappointed by the verdict in the #KyleRittenhouseTrial. This is yet another example of the clear bias in the justice system that must be addressed. We also need to pass gun safety reforms, so people like Kyle Rittenhouse don't have access to guns in the first place.

Immigration reform in the #BuildBackBetterAct¬†would improve the lives of millions of undocumented immigrants while boosting economic contributions and increasing tax revenue by billions. Congress must deliver for immigrant families by passing #ImmigrationReformNow. https://t.co/4SwNMoX4Tf
Thanks to @RepAnnaEshoo, @RepMcKinley and @RepLisaMcClain for joining me in introducing this resolution.

I'm very pleased that the bipartisan bill I cosponsored to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the 13 U.S. Service Members killed in Afghanistan this summer -- including Hoosier, Cpl. Humberto Sanchez -- has passed the Senate.

In any workplace in America, inciting violence against a coworker would be a grave offense. Why should the U.S. Congress be any different? That's why I voted to censure Rep. Paul Gosar. His social media post depicting the murder of another Member of this chamber is unacceptable.

Our transportation systems are only as strong as our people and our workers. In a place like Indiana, the Crossroads of America, we must address our roads and rails, but also support the people who move the goods America needs.

https://t.co/kqUspfcZXM

This #VeteransDay, let's recommit ourselves to the work we ought to be doing every day on behalf of our brave veterans. Actions speak louder than words. That's why my office is committed to helping veterans in the 7th congressional district any way we can.

For too long, past leaders only catered to the wealthiest among us. @HouseDemocrats are changing that. The #BuildBackBetter agenda focuses on strengthening the middle class and giving every American a fair shot at success. When we do this, out entire country benefits.

In this year alone, @HouseDemocrats have enacted legislation that:

- cuts child poverty in half 
- helped get millions of Americans vaccinated for free 
- creates millions of good-paying jobs to modernize our infrastructure

And we‚Äôre just getting started! 

#BuildBackBetter
